meanings.definition: A short crowbar for opening doors or windows.
meanings.sent1: The burglar used a jemmy to break into the house.
meanings.sent2: The handyman always carries a jemmy in his toolbox.
meanings.sent3: The jemmy made the door look like a piece of cake to open.
meanings.sent4: With the jemmy in hand, he felt like a modern-day knight with a sword.
meanings.sent5: The shiny jemmy gleamed in the moonlight as he worked to open the window.

meanings.definition: To force open with a crowbar.
meanings.sent1: He had to jemmy the stuck drawer open.
meanings.sent2: The thief tried to jemmy the lock but failed.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly threatened to jemmy the jar of pickles open.
meanings.sent4: The idea jemmied open his closed mind to new possibilities.
meanings.sent5: The detective jemmied the truth out of the suspect with clever questioning.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is remarkable or excellent.
meanings.sent1: She is a real jemmy when it comes to solving puzzles.
meanings.sent2: The new restaurant in town is a real jemmy for delicious food.
meanings.sent3: The jemmy of a sunset painted the sky in beautiful colors.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was a jemmy that unlocked the hearts of all who listened.
meanings.sent5: The jemmy of a friend is a treasure beyond measure.
